title: Selfridges unveils its CHRISTMAS windows 69 days before the big day
text:
Advertisement

Selfridges has unveiled its Christmas windows today - 69 days ahead of Santa's arrival.

Wanting to be ahead of the curve, the department store claims to be the first in the world to reveal its festive street-facing decorations.

This year's theme across the retailer's London, Birmingham and Manchester stores is Future Fantasy, A Christmas For Modern Times.

The centrepiece in the flagship Oxford Street store is a 42ft 8in high mirrored Christmas tree weighing 1.5 tonnes which hangs from the atrium and is illuminated by a daily light show.

Selfridges has unveiled its Christmas windows today (pictured). The centrepiece in the flagship Oxford Street store is a 42ft 8in high mirrored Christmas tree

Wanting to be ahead of the curve, the department store claims to be the first in the world to reveal its festive street-facing decorations

In the London store alone, a team has spent more than 500 hours producing the scheme over the past year. Pictured: A seemingly Frozen-inspired dress sits in the window

Customers in Birmingham can pose for photos inside an 11ft 6in wide snow globe which blows recyclable white and silver confetti around.

In the London store alone, a team has spent more than 500 hours producing the scheme over the past year.

Meanwhile, more than 100 people have worked non-stop rotating shifts over the past 10 days to prepare the windows.

This year's theme across the retailer's London, Birmingham and Manchester stores is Future Fantasy, A Christmas For Modern Times. Pictured: A silver Santa showcases the window displays

Shoes and boots on sale in the department store sit displayed on a floating island of snow

More than 100 people have worked non-stop rotating shifts over the past 10 days to prepare the windows, seen above

The Oxford Street store's biggest triple-sided window at the corner of Orchard Street features a 'magical shipwrecked feast among the waves' along the lines of The Owl And The Pussycat, complete with a giant moon and moving boat and oars.

Other windows feature scenes using Rapunzel, Cinderella, the Princess And The Pea, Jack And The Beanstalk and Goldilocks And The Three Bears as inspiration.

The Christmas focus for the retailer comes as it posted another year of record sales.

The company shrugged off the retail malaise weighing on the high street to increase sales by 6 per cent to £1.85billion for the year to February 2019.

However, it also saw operating profits slip to £170million, from £175million the previous year, as it increased investment across its portfolio.
description: This year's theme across the Selfridges' London, Birmingham and Manchester stores, which was unveiled today, is Future Fantasy, A Christmas For Modern Times.
